creator: charles.merriam@gmail.com
text:
In this paragraph:

The asterisks match all addresses, so the main server serves no requests. Due to the fact that www.example.com is first in the configuration file, it has the highest priority and can be seen as the default or primary server. That means that if a request is received that does not match one of the specified ServerName directives, it will be served by this first VirtualHost.

The "www.example.com" reference appears incorrect, or at least not shown in the file fragrment referenced.  I believe it meant to say "www.example1.com" or "www.example1".   The documentation should be brought in line with whatever reality has decided to be this year.

creator: rbowen@apache.org
text: Moving docs bugs to docs@httpd.a.o ownership.
Fixed in trunk docs by clarifying that the example is referring to the "ServerName www.example.com" line in the virtual host definition.  Thanks for pointing out the confusingness here.  r1031197
creator: poirier@pobox.com
